newsitem.title: UK: NWE gasoline steady, U.S. arbitrage closed.
newsitem.headline: NWE gasoline steady, U.S. arbitrage closed.

text.p: NWE gasoline was steady on Friday after a late slide in NYMEX futures counteracted most of the buoyant sentiment of the morning, traders said.
Barge markets started out strongly, with premium unleaded trading from $207.00 up to $208.25 per tonne, $1.00 above Thursday's high.
The arbitrage to the U.S. was completely closed, but up to 100,000 tonnes of demand was reported in eastern Europe for September.
An ARA refiner was offering premium and regular cargoes, and reported fob prices a couple of dollars below barges.
